articles.content:
Seoul citizens see Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities
   Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Seoul citizens have seen one after another a video tape on the revolutionary activities of General Secretary Kim Jong Il since early February on the occasion of his birthday, according to a report of the Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation quoting an information of the Seoul City Committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea.   
   In the first scene the tape shows General Secretary's portrait and letters "congratulations  on 57th birthday (1942-1999). Warm congratulations to the great leader Kim Jong Il on his birthday. February 16 Fellowship Society" against the background of a picture of Jong Il Peak and his native home in the secret camp on Mt. Paektu.   It introduces his brief biography with "Song of General Kim Jong Il."
   It also gives a documentary film on Kim Jong Il's inspection of units of the Korean People's Army and on-the-spot guidance to Jagang and north Phyongan provinces and different parts of the country last year and a scene on the launch of the artificial satellite "Kwangmyongsong 1."   Viewers have expressed respects for Kim Jong Il.

S. Korean authorities' proposal for dialogue rejected
   Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Federation of South Korean Trade Unions (Hangukrochong) on Monday resolutely rejected the proposal of Kim Jong Pil for dialogue aimed at retaining the deceptive "labour-management-government committee", a Seoul-based radio report said.   The organizations declared the "dialogue with 'government' would be meaningless" because the present chief executive in his "dialogue with people" distorted the reality arbitrarily by claiming the lay-off system "does not force workers to sacrifice themselves."    Therefore, feud between trade unions and the "government" is expected to be aggravated, said the report.
